units.description: essential people, places, things, and concepts

words.definition: the act of vibrating or moving back and forth quickly
words.example_sentence: He gave his wet umbrella a quick ~shake~ before coming inside.

words.definition: A surface or line forming the boundary of an object
words.example_sentence: She wrote her name on the left ~side~ of the paper.

words.definition: The ability to see or the act of seeing something
words.example_sentence: She lost her ~sight~ in a tragic accident many years ago.

words.definition: a place where a particular event or building is situated
words.example_sentence: The crew arrived at the construction ~site~ early this morning.

words.definition: the ability to do something well arising from talent or practice
words.example_sentence: She showed great ~skill~ while painting the detailed portrait.

words.definition: a formal talk or address delivered to an audience
words.example_sentence: The president gave a moving ~speech~ to the citizens.
words.image_term: person at a podium with microphones

words.definition: A short period of time or a turn of activity
words.example_sentence: We enjoyed a brief ~spell~ of warm weather during the winter.

words.definition: A particular place or point in a specific area
words.example_sentence: This is a quiet ~spot~ for a picnic in the park.

words.definition: A small structure used for selling goods or displaying information.
words.example_sentence: She bought a fresh glass of lemonade from the roadside ~stand~.

words.definition: an account of imaginary or real people and events told for entertainment
words.example_sentence: The grandmother told a bedtime ~story~ to the young children.

words.definition: an idea or plan put forward for consideration
words.example_sentence: I followed your ~suggestion~ and decided to take the train.

words.definition: The total amount of something, especially a quantity of money.
words.example_sentence: The bill came to a large ~sum~ of money.

words.definition: an unexpected or astonishing event, fact, or thing
words.example_sentence: The party was a complete ~surprise~ to her.

words.definition: A general view, examination, or description of someone or something
words.example_sentence: The government conducted a ~survey~ to gather public opinion on education.

words.definition: an inanimate object or a matter that exists or is mentioned
words.example_sentence: She put the small ~thing~ inside her pocket before leaving.

words.definition: The act of sending something through the air with force
words.example_sentence: He made a perfect ~throw~ to the second baseman.

words.definition: The highest part or upper surface of something
words.example_sentence: She placed the heavy box on the ~top~ of the shelf.

words.definition: A specific matter or theme discussed in a conversation or text
words.example_sentence: We need to choose a ~topic~ for our group presentation.

words.definition: the act or state of being in contact with something
words.example_sentence: She felt the light ~touch~ of a hand on her shoulder.

words.definition: An act of attempting to do or complete something
words.example_sentence: She gave the difficult puzzle another ~try~ to see if it worked.

words.definition: A long hollow object usually used to carry liquids or gases
words.example_sentence: Water flows through the copper ~tube~ to reach the faucet.

words.definition: a category of people or things having common characteristics
words.example_sentence: What ~type~ of music do you like to listen to?
words.image_term: assorted colorful buttons sorted by shape

words.definition: A horizontal line drawn beneath a word or piece of text
words.example_sentence: The important instruction was marked with a thick red ~underline~.

words.definition: a formal choice made by an individual in an election
words.example_sentence: She cast her ~vote~ for the new leader yesterday afternoon.

words.definition: The trail of disturbed water or air left by a moving object
words.example_sentence: The boat left a long white ~wake~ on the calm lake.

words.definition: A state of armed conflict between different countries or different groups
words.example_sentence: The two nations finally ended the long ~war~ after years of fighting.

words.definition: A desire or hope for something that may be unlikely or impossible
words.example_sentence: She made a silent ~wish~ before blowing out the birthday candles.

words.definition: A single unit of language used in writing or speech
words.example_sentence: I did not understand the meaning of that single ~word~.

words.definition: A feeling of anxiety or a problem that causes distress.
words.example_sentence: Her main ~worry~ was that she might miss the flight.

words.definition: of a standard that is satisfactory or acceptable but not excellent
words.example_sentence: The quality of the food was ~all right~ for the price.

words.definition: of poor quality or not pleasing in nature or effect
words.example_sentence: He felt sorry for his ~bad~ behavior at school.

words.definition: pleasing the senses or mind aesthetically with qualities of high quality
words.example_sentence: The sunset over the ocean was absolutely ~beautiful~ tonight.

words.definition: of the highest quality or excellence above all others
words.example_sentence: She won the prize for the ~best~ project in the class.

words.definition: of a higher standard or quality than something else
words.example_sentence: This new design is much ~better~ than the previous one.
words.image_term: shiny polished apple next to bruised apple

words.definition: of considerable size, extent, or intensity
words.example_sentence: The elephant is a very ~big~ animal.

words.definition: having no writing, images, or marks on a surface
words.example_sentence: Please write your name on the ~blank~ sheet of paper.

words.definition: damaged or no longer working correctly due to being fractured
words.example_sentence: He tried to fix the ~broken~ chair in the living room.

words.definition: actively engaged in an activity or having many things to do
words.example_sentence: She is very ~busy~ with her office work today.

words.definition: giving a lot of attention to what you are doing
words.example_sentence: Be ~careful~ when you walk across the slippery floor.

words.definition: quick to understand, learn, and devise ideas or methods
words.example_sentence: She came up with a ~clever~ way to solve the puzzle.

words.definition: Not open or available for use, entry, or business
words.example_sentence: The store is ~closed~ on Sundays.

words.definition: conforming to facts or truth without any errors
words.example_sentence: Please make sure that all the information provided is ~correct~.

words.definition: attractive in a pretty or endearing way
words.example_sentence: The puppy is very ~cute~ and has soft brown fur.

words.definition: regarded with deep affection, cherished, or very important to someone
words.example_sentence: She is a very ~dear~ friend of mine.

words.definition: having a very pleasant or highly pleasing taste or smell
words.example_sentence: The chef prepared a ~delicious~ chocolate cake for the birthday party.

words.definition: not the same as another or changed from a previous state
words.example_sentence: She wore a ~different~ dress to the party tonight.
words.image_term: one red apple among green apples

words.definition: needing much effort or skill to do or understand
words.example_sentence: The math exam was very ~difficult~ for the students.

words.definition: not clean or covered in substances like mud, dust, or grime
words.example_sentence: He washed his hands because they were very ~dirty~ after gardening.
words.image_term: muddy clothes in a laundry basket

words.definition: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time
words.example_sentence: The library books are ~due~ by next Tuesday morning.

words.definition: not difficult to do or requiring little effort
words.example_sentence: The math test was very ~easy~ for the students.

words.definition: relating to the most basic or simple level of something
words.example_sentence: She learned ~elementary~ math skills in her first year of school.

words.definition: Used or seen daily; suitable for ordinary days rather than special occasions.
words.example_sentence: She wore her ~everyday~ clothes to the park.

words.definition: extremely good or of very high quality
words.example_sentence: She did an ~excellent~ job on her science project.

words.definition: treating everyone equally and according to the rules or standards
words.example_sentence: The referee made a ~fair~ decision during the final minutes of the game.

words.definition: not true or not correct according to the facts
words.example_sentence: Is the statement true or ~false~?

words.definition: known and recognized by very many people
words.example_sentence: The actor became ~famous~ after starring in the blockbuster movie.
words.image_term: crowd taking photos of a celebrity

words.definition: moving or capable of moving at high speed
words.example_sentence: The ~fast~ sports car drove quickly down the open highway.

words.definition: having a large amount of excess flesh or body weight
words.example_sentence: The ~fat~ cat was sleeping on the kitchen floor.

words.definition: of high quality or acceptable standard in appearance or condition
words.example_sentence: The weather today is very ~fine~ for a walk in the park.

words.definition: coming before all others in time, order, or importance
words.example_sentence: She won the ~first~ prize in the school science competition.

words.definition: coming after something else in time or order
words.example_sentence: We will leave on the ~following~ day.

words.definition: Coming from or belonging to a country other than one's own.
words.example_sentence: She enjoys traveling to ~foreign~ countries to experience new cultures.

words.definition: costing nothing or provided without any requirement of payment
words.example_sentence: The hotel provides a ~free~ breakfast for all guests every morning.

words.definition: located at the forward part or surface of something
words.example_sentence: She sat in the ~front~ row to see the stage clearly.

words.definition: containing as much or as many as is possible or normal
words.example_sentence: The glass is ~full~ of cold water.

words.definition: providing entertainment, enjoyment, or lighthearted pleasure
words.example_sentence: We had a very ~fun~ time at the amusement park.
words.image_term: people laughing on a roller coaster

words.definition: causing laughter or amusement
words.example_sentence: The comedian told a very ~funny~ joke that made everyone laugh.

words.definition: having qualities that are desirable, beneficial, or of a high standard
words.example_sentence: She received a ~good~ grade on her difficult science test.

words.definition: of an extent, amount, or intensity considerably above the normal or average
words.example_sentence: We had a ~great~ time at the party last night.
words.image_term: smiling person giving a double thumbs up

words.definition: having a pleasing and impressive physical appearance, typically used for men
words.example_sentence: He looked very ~handsome~ in his new suit.

words.definition: not easily bent or out of shape, solid and firm
words.example_sentence: The wooden chair feels very ~hard~ to sit on.

words.definition: having good health and not being ill or injured
words.example_sentence: She eats a ~healthy~ diet and exercises every morning.

words.definition: having great weight or difficult to lift or move
words.example_sentence: This suitcase is too ~heavy~ for me to carry alone.

words.definition: extending far upward from the ground or a base
words.example_sentence: The mountain was so ~high~ that its peak was in the clouds.

words.definition: satisfying one's conception of what is perfect or most suitable
words.example_sentence: The sunny weather was ~ideal~ for a picnic in the park.

words.definition: having great value, significance, or influence in a particular context
words.example_sentence: It is ~important~ to drink plenty of water every day.
words.image_term: golden key on a velvet cushion

words.definition: of considerable or great size, quantity, or capacity
words.example_sentence: She lives in a ~large~ house with many rooms.

words.definition: unwilling to work or use energy to perform tasks
words.example_sentence: He spent the ~lazy~ afternoon lying on the couch watching movies.

words.definition: Located on the side of the body that contains the heart
words.example_sentence: She wears her watch on her ~left~ wrist.

words.definition: small in size, amount, degree, or scale
words.example_sentence: She lives in a ~little~ house by the ocean.

words.definition: currently alive and not dead or inanimate
words.example_sentence: Every ~living~ creature needs water and food to survive.

words.definition: measuring a great distance from one end to the other
words.example_sentence: The river follows a ~long~ path through the valley.

words.definition: very attractive, pleasant, or enjoyable to the senses
words.example_sentence: We had a ~lovely~ afternoon walking through the sunny park.

words.definition: located in the center or between two other things
words.example_sentence: He sat in the ~middle~ seat between his two friends.

words.definition: Produced, introduced, or discovered recently or for the first time
words.example_sentence: She decided to buy a ~new~ car for her daily commute.

words.definition: giving pleasure or satisfaction; being kind and friendly to others
words.example_sentence: It is a ~nice~ day to walk in the park.

words.definition: Not in operation, not functioning, or no longer flowing
words.example_sentence: Make sure the kitchen light is ~off~ before you go to bed.

words.definition: of a satisfactory or acceptable quality; good enough
words.example_sentence: The food was ~ok~, but it was not the best meal.

words.definition: having lived or existed for a long time
words.example_sentence: The ~old~ man sat on the park bench.

words.definition: Being the one and single one of its kind
words.example_sentence: She was the ~only~ child in the entire family.

words.definition: belonging to or done by a particular person and no others
words.example_sentence: She used her ~own~ money to buy the book.

words.definition: belonging to or affecting a particular person rather than anyone else
words.example_sentence: She kept her ~personal~ letters in a locked wooden box.

words.definition: having very little money and not enough for basic needs
words.example_sentence: The ~poor~ family struggled to pay for their monthly rent.

words.definition: pleasing to the eye or having a charming appearance
words.example_sentence: She wore a ~pretty~ dress to the summer garden party.

words.definition: making very little noise or having little activity or excitement
words.example_sentence: Please be ~quiet~ while the baby is sleeping in the next room.

words.definition: fully prepared or available for immediate use or action
words.example_sentence: The students are ~ready~ to start their morning lessons.

words.definition: actually existing as a thing or occurring in fact not imaginary
words.example_sentence: Is that a ~real~ diamond or just a piece of glass?

words.definition: having a great deal of money or many valuable assets
words.example_sentence: He became very ~rich~ after starting his own successful company.

words.definition: conforming to facts or truth and being free from error
words.example_sentence: She gave the ~right~ answer to the difficult math question.

words.definition: behaving in a way that is not polite or shows disrespect
words.example_sentence: It is very ~rude~ to interrupt people while they are speaking.

words.definition: exactly alike, not different, or the very same one
words.example_sentence: We are wearing the ~same~ blue shirt today.

words.definition: coming after the first in time, order, importance, or position
words.example_sentence: She was the ~second~ person to arrive at the party.

words.definition: measuring a small distance from one end to the other
words.example_sentence: She wore a ~short~ dress to the summer party.

words.definition: taking a long time to move or happen
words.example_sentence: Traffic was very ~slow~ during the heavy rain.

words.definition: having little size or amount compared to others of its kind
words.example_sentence: She lives in a ~small~ apartment in the middle of the city.

words.definition: having or showing a quick-witted and high mental capacity
words.example_sentence: She is a very ~smart~ student who always gets high grades.

words.definition: relating to being with other people and enjoying their company
words.example_sentence: She is very ~social~ and loves meeting new people at parties.

words.definition: better, greater, or otherwise different from what is usual
words.example_sentence: She received a ~special~ gift for her birthday today.

words.definition: Not moving or making any sound
words.example_sentence: The lake was perfectly ~still~ on the quiet morning.

words.definition: different from what is usual, normal, or expected
words.example_sentence: I heard a ~strange~ noise coming from the basement last night.

words.definition: demanding that rules or behavior are followed exactly and without exception
words.example_sentence: The school has ~strict~ rules about wearing the correct uniform.

words.definition: having great physical power or the ability to resist weight or pressure
words.example_sentence: He is ~strong~ enough to lift the heavy box by himself.

words.definition: achieving wealth, respect, or a desired result
words.example_sentence: The young businessman became very ~successful~ after years of hard work.

words.definition: of very high quality or extremely good
words.example_sentence: She did a ~super~ job on her final presentation.

words.definition: feeling confident in the truth or accuracy of something
words.example_sentence: Are you ~sure~ that you turned off the oven?

words.definition: having a taste similar to that of sugar or honey
words.example_sentence: This ripe orange is very ~sweet~ and juicy.

words.definition: having a relatively great distance from the bottom to the top
words.example_sentence: The ~tall~ man reached the top shelf easily.

words.definition: extremely poor in quality or very unpleasant to experience
words.example_sentence: I had a ~terrible~ headache after the long flight home.

words.definition: having a large distance between opposite sides or surfaces
words.example_sentence: She wore a ~thick~ wool coat to stay warm outside.

words.definition: having little flesh or fat on the body
words.example_sentence: She has become very ~thin~ since she started running every day.

words.definition: fitting very closely to the body or held firmly in place
words.example_sentence: These new shoes are a bit too ~tight~ on my feet.

words.definition: consistent with fact or reality and not false
words.example_sentence: Is it ~true~ that you are moving to a new house?

words.definition: unpleasant or repulsive to look at; not beautiful or pleasing
words.example_sentence: The old house looked ~ugly~ because it was falling apart.

words.definition: in good health or feeling physically fit
words.example_sentence: She went home because she did not feel ~well~ today.

words.definition: inspiring delight, pleasure, or admiration; extremely good or marvelous
words.example_sentence: We had a ~wonderful~ time at the party last night.

words.definition: not correct or not in agreement with truth or facts
words.example_sentence: I gave the ~wrong~ answer to the final question on the test.

words.definition: having lived or existed for only a short period of time
words.example_sentence: The ~young~ puppy played in the grass all afternoon.

units.title: Essential Adverbs (1)
units.description: essential words for how, when, and where

words.definition: used to indicate an estimated number, amount, or time
words.example_sentence: I will arrive at ~about~ five o'clock this evening.

words.definition: at or to a higher place or position
words.example_sentence: The birds were flying high ~above~ in the sky.

words.definition: one more time or back to a previous place or state
words.example_sentence: I missed the bus, so I have to wait ~again~.

words.definition: at a certain time in the past before the present moment
words.example_sentence: I moved to this city five years ~ago~.

words.definition: very close to a certain state, quality, or amount
words.example_sentence: I have ~almost~ finished my homework for tonight.

words.definition: without any other people or things present
words.example_sentence: She likes to sit ~alone~ in the quiet library.

words.definition: moving in a forward direction or in the company of others
words.example_sentence: She decided to bring her little brother ~along~ to the park.

words.definition: before a particular time or sooner than expected
words.example_sentence: I have ~already~ finished my homework for tonight.

words.definition: in addition to something else already mentioned
words.example_sentence: She is a talented singer and ~also~ plays the piano.

words.definition: at all times, on every occasion, or without exception
words.example_sentence: She ~always~ eats breakfast before going to school.

words.definition: to or at a distance from a particular place or person
words.example_sentence: She turned her face ~away~ to look out the window.

words.definition: at a time in the past or preceding a specific event
words.example_sentence: I have never seen this movie ~before~.

words.definition: at or toward the back of something
words.example_sentence: The dog ran ahead while the cat stayed ~behind~.

words.definition: at or to a lower level, position, or place
words.example_sentence: From the mountain peak, we could see the valley ~below~.

words.definition: Used with 'and' to emphasize that two things are included
words.example_sentence: She is ~both~ talented and hard-working.

words.definition: acting with great attention to detail to avoid mistakes or danger
words.example_sentence: She held the fragile glass vase ~carefully~ so it would not break.

words.definition: toward a lower place or position
words.example_sentence: The sun is going ~down~ behind the mountains.

words.definition: used to indicate a similarity between two negative statements
words.example_sentence: I do not like coffee and he does not ~either~.

words.definition: in addition to something else or in a different way
words.example_sentence: I have nothing ~else~ to say to you today.

words.definition: in or to all places or parts of an area
words.example_sentence: The children left their toys ~everywhere~ in the house.

words.definition: in, at, or to this position or location
words.example_sentence: Please come ~here~ and sit down next to me.

words.definition: In what manner or by what means something is done
words.example_sentence: She explained ~how~ the machine works to the new staff.

words.definition: simply or only to a small degree or extent
words.example_sentence: I ~just~ want a glass of water please.

words.definition: at a time in the future or after a specific event
words.example_sentence: I will finish my homework ~later~ tonight.

units.title: Essential Adverbs (2)
units.description: essential words for how, when, and where

words.definition: to a great extent or very much
words.example_sentence: I like to travel a ~lot~ during the summer.

words.definition: used to express uncertainty or a possibility that something may happen
words.example_sentence: I think ~maybe~ it will rain later this afternoon.

words.definition: to a great extent or degree
words.example_sentence: I do not like this ~much~ at all.

words.definition: at no time in the past or in the future
words.example_sentence: I ~never~ drink coffee after seven in the evening.

words.definition: used as an adverb to mean not any or not any more
words.example_sentence: He is ~no~ longer living here after the big move.

words.definition: Used to express negation, denial, refusal, or the opposite of something
words.example_sentence: She is ~not~ coming to the party tonight.

words.definition: many times on different occasions or at short intervals
words.example_sentence: I ~often~ visit the library after school to read books.

words.definition: on only one occasion or at one time in the past
words.example_sentence: I have only visited that city ~once~ in my life.

words.definition: moving away from the center or the inside of a place
words.example_sentence: She opened the door and walked ~out~ into the garden.

words.definition: in or to the open air or exterior of a building
words.example_sentence: It is finally sunny so let's go ~outside~ to play.

words.definition: Moving from one side to the other side of something
words.example_sentence: The blue car drove quickly ~past~ without stopping.

words.definition: at a high speed or within a short space of time
words.example_sentence: She finished her work ~quickly~ and left the office.

words.definition: To a great degree or in actual fact
words.example_sentence: I ~really~ like this new music.

words.definition: in a direct line or without delay or deviation
words.example_sentence: He went ~straight~ home after the party ended.

words.definition: at a particular time in the past or future
words.example_sentence: I lived in London ~then~, but now I live in Paris.

words.definition: at, in, or to that specific place or position
words.example_sentence: I left my keys over ~there~ on the wooden table.

words.definition: with each other or in a group with others
words.example_sentence: We like to cook dinner ~together~ every Sunday evening.
words.image_term: people holding hands in a circle

words.definition: To a higher degree than is desirable, permissible, or possible.
words.example_sentence: The coffee is ~too~ hot to drink right now.

words.definition: under normal conditions or in most cases
words.example_sentence: I ~usually~ drink coffee in the morning.

words.definition: To a great degree or in a high degree
words.example_sentence: The weather today is ~very~ hot and sunny.

words.definition: at or during which time or period
words.example_sentence: I will tell you ~when~ the meeting begins.

words.definition: at, in, or to what place or position
words.example_sentence: I do not know ~where~ my keys are.

words.definition: used to ask about the cause, reason, or purpose of something
words.example_sentence: I do not understand ~why~ the store is closed today.

words.definition: up until the present time or now
words.example_sentence: I have not finished my dinner ~yet~.

words.definition: Used before a singular noun to refer to one non-specific thing
words.example_sentence: She has ~a~ red apple on her desk.

words.definition: at a later time or behind in place or order
words.example_sentence: We will go to the park ~after~ lunch today.

words.definition: The whole quantity or amount of something or a complete group
words.example_sentence: She invited ~all~ the students in her class to the party.

words.definition: Indefinite article used before words beginning with a vowel sound
words.example_sentence: She ate ~an~ apple for her afternoon snack.

words.definition: used to connect words, phrases, clauses, or sentences
words.example_sentence: I would like bread ~and~ butter for breakfast.

words.definition: one additional person or thing of the same type
words.example_sentence: Would you like ~another~ cup of tea?

words.definition: one or more of something, no matter which one
words.example_sentence: I do not have ~any~ bread left in the kitchen.

words.definition: any person or people at all, used in questions and negatives
words.example_sentence: Is there ~anybody~ home right now?

words.definition: any person or people, regardless of who they are
words.example_sentence: Is there ~anyone~ in the room who can help me?

words.definition: a thing of any kind or any matter whatsoever
words.example_sentence: I do not have ~anything~ in my pocket right now.

words.definition: on every side of something or in a circular movement
words.example_sentence: The children ran ~around~ the large oak tree in the garden.

words.definition: at the same time that something else is happening
words.example_sentence: He watched the birds ~as~ he sat on the bench.

words.definition: A preposition used to indicate a specific location or point in time.
words.example_sentence: She is waiting ~at~ the bus stop right now.

words.definition: A conjunction used to introduce a reason or cause for something.
words.example_sentence: I am staying inside ~because~ it is raining.

words.definition: at the side of or next to something or someone
words.example_sentence: She sat ~beside~ her friend during the long movie.

words.definition: in the space separating two objects, people, points, or times
words.example_sentence: The small table is ~between~ the two blue chairs.

words.definition: used to introduce a phrase or clause contrasting with what preceded
words.example_sentence: I wanted to go outside ~but~ it started to rain.

words.definition: identifying a position at the side of or next to something
words.example_sentence: She sat ~by~ the window to watch the rain.

words.definition: every one of two or more people or things considered separately
words.example_sentence: The teacher gave ~each~ of the students a new notebook.

words.definition: used to show that two or more people perform same action
words.example_sentence: They looked at ~each other~ and smiled after the long race.

words.definition: used to refer to all individual members of a group
words.example_sentence: She eats an apple ~every~ day for breakfast.

words.definition: every person or all the people in a group
words.example_sentence: I hope ~everybody~ had a good time at the party.

words.definition: every person in a group or all people in general
words.example_sentence: I hope ~everyone~ has a wonderful time at the party tonight.
words.image_term: a large group of smiling people

words.definition: all items or the entire amount of something
words.example_sentence: She packed ~everything~ she needed into her small suitcase.

words.definition: indicating the person or thing that something is given to
words.example_sentence: This gift is ~for~ you.

words.definition: indicating the point of origin or beginning of something
words.example_sentence: The train traveled ~from~ the city to the coast.

words.definition: a third person singular pronoun referring to a male human
words.example_sentence: I saw the man and ~he~ was walking toward the park.

words.definition: The objective or possessive case of the feminine pronoun she
words.example_sentence: I gave ~her~ the book and then thanked ~her~ for the help.

words.definition: the one or ones belonging to a female person or animal
words.example_sentence: The blue bag is mine, but the red one is ~hers~.

words.definition: the objective case of he, used as a direct or indirect object
words.example_sentence: I saw ~him~ at the library yesterday.

words.definition: belonging to or associated with a male person or animal
words.example_sentence: He left ~his~ keys on the wooden table.

words.definition: The person who is speaking or writing
words.example_sentence: I think that ~I~ can help you with that task.

words.definition: Introducing a conditional clause or a requirement for something to happen.
words.example_sentence: I will go ~if~ you come with me.

words.definition: Expressing the situation of something that is or appears to be enclosed
words.example_sentence: The keys are ~in~ the small blue box.

words.definition: Situated within the boundaries or interior of a space or object
words.example_sentence: The cat is hiding ~inside~ the cardboard box.

words.definition: Expressing movement or action with the result that someone or something becomes enclosed
words.example_sentence: She walked ~into~ the house to escape the rain.

words.definition: A pronoun used to refer to a previously mentioned thing or animal.
words.example_sentence: I found a blue ball and picked ~it~ up.

words.definition: Belonging to or associated with a thing previously mentioned or easily identified.
words.example_sentence: The dog wagged ~its~ tail when I arrived home.

words.definition: Consisting of a large number of people or things
words.example_sentence: There are ~many~ books on the shelf in the library.

words.definition: The objective case of the first-person singular pronoun I
words.example_sentence: She gave the book to ~me~ yesterday.

words.definition: that which belongs to the person speaking
words.example_sentence: That blue car is ~mine~, but the red one belongs to Sarah.

words.definition: A greater amount or number of something than before.
words.example_sentence: I would like some ~more~ water please.

words.definition: The greatest amount, quantity, or degree of something
words.example_sentence: She has the ~most~ points in the game.

words.definition: of or belonging to the speaker or writer
words.example_sentence: I need to find ~my~ keys before I leave the house.

words.definition: at or within a short distance in space or time
words.example_sentence: The chair is ~near~ the wooden table.

words.definition: not a single thing or no thing at all
words.example_sentence: I have ~nothing~ in my pockets right now.

words.definition: expressing the relationship between a part and a whole
words.example_sentence: The cover ~of~ the book is bright red.

words.definition: physically touching and supported by the top surface of something
words.example_sentence: The book is ~on~ the wooden table.

words.definition: A conjunction used to connect two or more possibilities or alternatives
words.example_sentence: Would you like tea ~or~ coffee with your breakfast?

words.definition: referring to a person or thing distinct from those already mentioned
words.example_sentence: I have one apple, but where are the ~other~ fruits?

words.definition: belonging to or associated with the speaker and one or more others
words.example_sentence: We parked ~our~ car in the driveway.

words.definition: the one or ones belonging to or associated with us
words.example_sentence: They have their car and we have ~ours~ parked outside.

words.definition: in or at a position above or higher than something else
words.example_sentence: The lamp hangs ~over~ the dining table.

words.definition: referring to a female person or animal previously mentioned or identified
words.example_sentence: After finishing her homework, ~she~ went for a walk in the park.

words.definition: for that reason or as a result of something mentioned
words.example_sentence: It was raining ~so~ I took an umbrella with me.

words.definition: an unspecified amount or number of something
words.example_sentence: I would like ~some~ water with my meal please.

words.definition: an unknown or unspecified person
words.example_sentence: I think ~someone~ is knocking on the door.

words.definition: A thing that is not known, named, or specified
words.example_sentence: I have ~something~ for you in my pocket.

words.definition: Used to introduce the second element in a comparison
words.example_sentence: She is taller ~than~ her brother.

words.definition: A relative pronoun used to introduce a clause identifying a person or thing
words.example_sentence: The book ~that~ you bought is on the table.

words.definition: Used to refer to specific people or things already mentioned or known
words.example_sentence: Please place ~the~ book on that specific table.

words.definition: belonging to or associated with the people or things previously mentioned
words.example_sentence: The students opened ~their~ books to the first page.

words.definition: The objective case of the plural pronoun referring to others
words.example_sentence: I saw my friends and invited ~them~ to the party.

words.definition: plural form of this, referring to nearby people or things
words.example_sentence: Please take ~these~ books with you to the library.

words.definition: Used to refer to two or more people previously mentioned
words.example_sentence: The students are here and ~they~ are ready to learn.

words.definition: referring to a specific person, thing, or idea nearby or just mentioned
words.example_sentence: I want to buy ~this~ instead of that one.

words.definition: the plural form of that, referring to distant people or things
words.example_sentence: I like ~those~ shoes over there by the door.

words.definition: moving from one side to the other side of an opening
words.example_sentence: The sunlight shines ~through~ the open window.

words.definition: Expressing motion or direction toward a person, place, or thing
words.example_sentence: She walked ~to~ the library to study her books.

words.definition: in or to a lower position than something else
words.example_sentence: The cat is sleeping ~under~ the wooden table.

words.definition: up to a specified time or event and no longer
words.example_sentence: We waited at the station ~until~ the clock struck midnight.

words.definition: toward a higher position or a greater level
words.example_sentence: The elevator went ~up~ to the tenth floor.

words.definition: the objective case of the first person plural pronoun we
words.example_sentence: She gave ~us~ a lot of homework to finish by Monday.
words.image_term: group of friends pointing to themselves

words.definition: the speaker and one or more other people together
words.example_sentence: After the movie, ~we~ went to get some pizza.

words.definition: Interrogative pronoun used to ask for information about a thing.
words.example_sentence: I do not know ~what~ is inside the box.

words.definition: A relative pronoun or determiner used to refer to specific choices
words.example_sentence: He could not decide ~which~ car to buy.

words.definition: What or which person or people, used to introduce a question
words.example_sentence: I want to know ~who~ is coming to the party tonight.

words.definition: belonging to or associated with which person or thing
words.example_sentence: This is the man ~whose~ car was stolen yesterday.

words.definition: accompanied by another person or thing in a shared situation
words.example_sentence: She went to the park ~with~ her best friend.

words.definition: the person or people being addressed by the speaker
words.example_sentence: I hope that ~you~ have a wonderful time at the party.

words.definition: belonging to or associated with the person the speaker is addressing
words.example_sentence: Please remember to bring ~your~ book to the class tomorrow.

words.definition: the thing or things belonging to the person being spoken to
words.example_sentence: I found my keys, but I cannot find ~yours~.

words.definition: the reflexive form of the pronoun you used as the object
words.example_sentence: You should take some time to look after ~yourself~ today.
